implementationmode.label: Implementation mode
implementationmode.helperText: Choose the type of work the agent should perform.

options.label: Feature
options.instruction: New functionality must be delivered with production-ready TypeScript/React code that matches existing architecture and patterns.

options.label: Bugfix
options.description: Eliminate regressions with the minimal safe change.
options.instruction: The regression root cause must be identified, the minimal safe fix must be applied, and preventative tests must accompany the change.

options.label: Refactor
options.description: Improve structure without altering behavior or scope.
options.instruction: Current behavior must be preserved while restructuring the code for clarity and maintainability; new capabilities must not be introduced.

options.label: Exploration
options.description: Investigate options and recommend a concrete plan.
options.instruction: The problem space must be investigated, viable implementation approaches must be compared, and a path must be recommended with trade-off analysis.

scope.label: Scope
scope.helperText: Describe how broad the change should be.

options.label: Small
options.description: Touch a focused area (one or two modules).
options.instruction: Work must be kept tightly scoped (one or two modules) and collateral changes must be minimized.

options.label: Medium
options.instruction: Updates must be coordinated across several modules and any required sequencing or coupling must be highlighted.

options.label: Large
options.description: Plan staged delivery for broad, multi-area work.
options.instruction: Staged delivery must be planned for broad changes, including migration steps, safeguards, and rollback strategy.

options.label: Unit
options.description: Add/extend unit tests for the touched code.
options.instruction: Add or update unit tests for the affected code paths. Avoid adding new dependencies; use existing test utilities.

options.label: Integration
options.instruction: Ensure end-to-end/integration coverage for the feature. Prefer existing test harnesses; document setup if new commands are required.

options.label: No tests
options.instruction: Testing may be omitted only if fully justified (e.g., non-code change). Document why tests are not added.

options.label: No access
options.description: Assume no logs or dashboards available.
options.instruction: Assume no runtime access or live logs. Plan changes that can be validated via local tests or static analysis.

options.label: Logs only
options.instruction: Assume read-only access to logs/metrics. Proposed changes should include log/metric hooks if they improve observability.

options.label: Full access
options.description: Assume we can run and inspect.
options.instruction: Assume the ability to run the service and inspect runtime state. Use this to justify deeper diagnostics or interactive verification.

options.label: Minimal
options.instruction: Update only the relevant docs (README, inline comments) necessary for the change. No broad rewrites.

options.label: Expanded
options.instruction: Add or expand supporting docs (runbooks, guides) where it improves maintainability or onboarding for this change.

surfaceareas.label: Surface areas
surfaceareas.helperText: Emphasize areas to pay attention to.

options.label: Performance
options.instruction: Call out performance implications (latency, throughput, memory, bundle size). Optimize or note trade-offs.

options.label: Accessibility
options.instruction: Ensure accessibility: focus order, keyboard operability, ARIA/semantic markup, and contrast remain valid.

options.label: Security
options.instruction: Highlight security implications (authn/z, secrets, sandboxing). Avoid introducing new risks; document any that remain.

options.label: Compatibility
options.instruction: Preserve compatibility: supported browsers/OS, API contracts, and backward-compat expectations for interfaces.

options.label: Observability
options.instruction: Ensure adequate observability: logs/metrics/traces cover new flows; avoid noisy or sensitive logging.
